item.description:
This will be our first workshop in the Bridgton area! This is the time to think ahead as you plant out your Summer harvest for the transition into Fall and Winter Harvest. Certain plants need up 10-12 weeks of start time prior to the first Fall frost!Growing in Maine year round is possible!
Topics to be discussed:
- David Homa's time tested and perfected hinged hoop house construction
-Fall,Winter and early Spring plant selections and start times( especially Winter crops prior to frost!)
- other alternative forms of Season Extension
- using your structure as a root cellar!
- pest control in your season extension structure
- proper mulching methods inside and outside of your structure
- forcing roots for greens in your home
- Photos archives of our homestead's success with crops that usually cant pull off in their "off season"

Attendees will leave with plant selection and growing schedules as well as the hinged hoop house construction recipe!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Season Extension (Bridgton) Winter Harvest & Hoop House Construction
